description: From Middle English nothyng, noon thing, non thing, na þing, nan thing, nan þing, from Old English nāþing, nān þing (“nothing”, literally “not any thing”), equivalent to no +‎ thing. Compare Old English nāwiht (“nothing”, literally “no thing”), Swedish ingenting (“nothing”, literally “not any thing, no thing”).

entries.meaning: (archaic) Not at all; in no way.
Something trifling, or of no consequence or importance.
examples: - What happened to your face?- It's nothing.

entries.meaning: A trivial remark especially in the term sweet nothings.
